tool.name: OSP candidates
tool.description: constructs a putative list of potential o-spanin from an input genomic FASTA

param.label: Lipobox minimal distance from start codon
param.name: osp_min_dist

param.label: Lipobox maximum distance from start codon
param.name: osp_max_dist

tool.help:
**What it does** INPUT : Genomic FASTA
METHODOLOGY Initially uses the OrfFinder module from CPT.py and locates ALL potential start sequences, based on ttg / atg / gtg (M / L / V)
This generates a set of output files consisting of FASTA / BED / GFF3 With the aaFASTA, this tool reads in each potential sequence and determines if it has a lipobox based off of:
> Min distance from start codon to lipobox
> Max distance from start codon to lipobox
Within that minimum and maximum range, a regular expression (RegEx) is used to determine if a lipobox is found. If so, it is added to a candidate list, and eventually ported to a file in the output.
OUTPUT : putative_osp.fa (FASTA) file.
